title: Reporting an Adverse Event
transcript: Speaker 1: Good morning. I’d like to report an adverse event from one of my doctors.
Speaker 2: Sure, please go ahead. What happened?
Speaker 1: The patient developed a mild skin rash two days after starting the new batch of Amoxiril 500 mg. The doctor stopped the medication, and the rash cleared within 48 hours.
Speaker 2: Thank you. Do you have the patient’s initials, age, and gender?
Speaker 1: Yes, it’s M.A., a 45-year-old male. The doctor didn’t report any other reactions.
Speaker 2: Perfect. Please send me the completed adverse event form today so we can log it in the system.
Speaker 1: Will do. I’ll email it to you right after this call.
questions: What reaction did the patient experience?
What action did the doctor take?
How long did it take for the rash to clear?
What information did the medical department ask for?
What did the rep promise to do at the end of the call?
answerKey: Two days after starting the new batch.
Send the completed adverse event form by email.

vocabulary.meaning: Any unwanted medical occurrence after taking a drug
vocabulary.example: We must report all adverse events within 24 hours.

vocabulary.meaning: A group of products made at the same time
vocabulary.example: The issue was linked to the latest batch.
The symptoms cleared after the drug was stopped.

vocabulary.meaning: To give official information about an event
vocabulary.example: Please report this incident to the medical department.

vocabulary.meaning: An unwanted effect caused by a medicine
vocabulary.example: The patient had a mild allergic reaction.
The team will log the case in the system.

roleplay.rep: You received a report of nausea and dizziness after Painol 200 mg. Call the medical department, provide key details (initials, age, gender, reaction, timing, action, outcome), and ask if other information is needed.
roleplay.medical: A rep calls to report an adverse event. Ask for product, dose, reaction, timing, patient info, and action taken. Remind the rep to send the adverse event form.
